      String type()
      The type of joint, which must be one of the following:\n (revolute) a hinge joint that rotates on a single axis with either a fixed or continuous range of motion,\n (gearbox) geared revolute joints,\n (revolute2) same as two revolute joints connected in series,\n (prismatic) a sliding joint that slides along an axis with a limited range specified by upper and lower limits,\n (ball) a ball and socket joint,\n (screw) a single degree of freedom joint with coupled sliding and rotational motion,\n (universal) like a ball joint, but constrains one degree of freedom,\n (fixed) a joint with zero degrees of freedom that rigidly connects two links.\n
      WorldJoint.Builder type(String value)
      The type of joint, which must be one of the following:\n (revolute) a hinge joint that rotates on a single axis with either a fixed or continuous range of motion,\n (gearbox) geared revolute joints,\n (revolute2) same as two revolute joints connected in series,\n (prismatic) a sliding joint that slides along an axis with a limited range specified by upper and lower limits,\n (ball) a ball and socket joint,\n (screw) a single degree of freedom joint with coupled sliding and rotational motion,\n (universal) like a ball joint, but constrains one degree of freedom,\n (fixed) a joint with zero degrees of freedom that rigidly connects two links.\n

      • type

        public final String type()
        The type of joint, which must be one of the following:\n (revolute) a hinge joint that rotates on a single axis with either a fixed or continuous range of motion,\n (gearbox) geared revolute joints,\n (revolute2) same as two revolute joints connected in series,\n (prismatic) a sliding joint that slides along an axis with a limited range specified by upper and lower limits,\n (ball) a ball and socket joint,\n (screw) a single degree of freedom joint with coupled sliding and rotational motion,\n (universal) like a ball joint, but constrains one degree of freedom,\n (fixed) a joint with zero degrees of freedom that rigidly connects two links.\n

      • type

        public final WorldJoint.Builder type(String value)
        The type of joint, which must be one of the following:\n (revolute) a hinge joint that rotates on a single axis with either a fixed or continuous range of motion,\n (gearbox) geared revolute joints,\n (revolute2) same as two revolute joints connected in series,\n (prismatic) a sliding joint that slides along an axis with a limited range specified by upper and lower limits,\n (ball) a ball and socket joint,\n (screw) a single degree of freedom joint with coupled sliding and rotational motion,\n (universal) like a ball joint, but constrains one degree of freedom,\n (fixed) a joint with zero degrees of freedom that rigidly connects two links.\n

      • gearboxRatio

        public final Double gearboxRatio()
        Parameter for gearbox joints. Given theta_1 and theta_2 defined in description for gearbox_reference_body, theta_2 = -gearbox_ratio * theta_1.

      • gearboxRatio

        public final WorldJoint.Builder gearboxRatio(Double value)
        Parameter for gearbox joints. Given theta_1 and theta_2 defined in description for gearbox_reference_body, theta_2 = -gearbox_ratio * theta_1.

      • gearboxReferenceBody

        public final String gearboxReferenceBody()
        Parameter for gearbox joints. Gearbox ratio is enforced over two joint angles. First joint angle (theta_1) is the angle from the gearbox_reference_body to the parent link in the direction of the axis element and the second joint angle (theta_2) is the angle from the gearbox_reference_body to the child link in the direction of the axis2 element.

      • gearboxReferenceBody

        public final WorldJoint.Builder gearboxReferenceBody(String value)
        Parameter for gearbox joints. Gearbox ratio is enforced over two joint angles. First joint angle (theta_1) is the angle from the gearbox_reference_body to the parent link in the direction of the axis element and the second joint angle (theta_2) is the angle from the gearbox_reference_body to the child link in the direction of the axis2 element.
